name: German Music
description: Music of the German-speaking people, spanning predominately central Europe, primarily Germany, Austria, and Switzerland, among others.

children.name: Guggenmusik
children.description: Alemannic type of Marching Band played at carnival events, featuring a cacophonous, seemingly "out of tune" sound.

children.name: Lied
children.description: Form of song arising from 19th century German Romanticism, usually for solo vocalist & piano with a text derived from poetry.

children.name: Liedermacher
children.description: German style having its origins in literature and theatre rather than American forms like Blues or Rock.

children.name: Luxembourgish Folk Music
children.description: Traditional folk music of the Luxembourgish people.

children.name: Ländler
children.description: Swiss-German dance band music based on the accordion, combining traditional Alpine Folk Music with elements from Schlager and Jazz.

children.name: Romantische Oper
children.description: Early 19th century Germanic style of Opera influenced by German Folk Music and legends with a focus on fantasy, emotivity, heroic figures, and nationalism.

children.name: Volkstümliche Musik
children.description: Light Pop with borrowings from German Folk Music (volksmusik), often misleadingly labeled as being volksmusik.

children.name: Zeitoper
children.description: Short-lived scene in Weimar Germany, often having satirical plots and allusions to popular music.
